body:
I think this falls into the [special functions](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/syntax/special-functions) category – why you need to use [interpolation](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/interpolation) to turn the [parent selector ](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/style-rules/parent-selector)into a chunk of CSS.


```
.my-class
  :where(#{&}) 
    color: red
```

> I think this falls into the [special functions](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/syntax/special-functions) category – why you need to use [interpolation](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/interpolation) to turn the [parent selector ](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/style-rules/parent-selector)into a chunk of CSS.
> 
> ```
> .my-class
>   :where(#{&}) 
>     color: red
> ```

I'm not 100% sure I understand what you're saying but thanks for pointing out the workaround

> I think this falls into the [special functions](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/syntax/special-functions) category – why you need to use [interpolation](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/interpolation) to turn the [parent selector ](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/style-rules/parent-selector)into a chunk of CSS.
> 
> ```
> .my-class
>   :where(#{&}) 
>     color: red
> ```

this actually results in
```css
.my-class :where(.my-class) {
  color: red;
}
```
so it does not work as a workaround

You're right. `:where` should generally behave like `:is`, but with added special handling of the specifity (e.g. when trimming selectors for `@extend`).

Since this is a language change and will need to go through the formal language feature process, I'm moving this to the Sass language repo.

issue.title: use `:where()` to decrease specificity of name background color fallback
issue.body:
this fixes a problem where all item name backgrounds are grey after #750

`:where()` is broken in sass right now. see: https://github.com/sass/sass/issues/3130
so I am using the workaround suggested by @jakob-e

issue.title: Add spec for where pseudo-selector nesting
issue.body:
In this PR I attempt to add a spec for sass/sass#3130

I have never worked with the sass spec before so please let me know if I did something wrong

I have not tested this change on my local machine

issue.title: Referencing & from within :not()

body: @nex3 `:where` is also not parsed as a pseudo-class using an inner selector in dart-sass: https://github.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/52ef3c6ef17aec7cc1f9602671de666d35d0b0b3/lib/src/parse/selector.dart#L13-L23

issue.title: 🛑 [BUG] `:is(&)` ⇒ compiling BUT `:where(&)` don't
🛑 [BUG] `:is(&)` ⇒ compiling BUT `:where(&)` don't

repository.name: dart-sass
repository.description: The reference implementation of Sass, written in Dart.

issue.title: Add support for :where()
issue.body:
Fixes #3130.

In addition to updating the procedure for extending a simple selector to
treat `:where` the same as `:is` and `:matches`, this also modifies the
second law of extend to account for specificity being modified by
pseudoselectors like `:where`.

This is a fast-track proposal.
